sentences.en: ...the best chance in 20 years to end the scourge of terrorism.
sentences.cn: …20年来结束恐怖主义灾难的最佳机会。

sentences.en: Accordingly, Maiev told Malfurion that Tyrande had been killed by the Scourge.
sentences.cn: 于是, 玛维告诉玛法里奥,泰兰德被天灾军团杀掉了.

sentences.en: After the scourge of war came the scourge of disease.
sentences.cn: 战乱之后瘟疫接踵而来.

sentences.en: Do you think the death of Lorenzo is the scourge God has propared for Florence?
sentences.cn: 你们以为洛伦索死了,是上帝给佛罗伦萨的惩罚?

sentences.en: Economic anarchy scourged the post-war world.
sentences.cn: 经济混乱蹂躏战后世界。

sentences.en: Farmers don't need much prompting to tell you that "flaming dog owners" are the scourge of their lives.
sentences.cn: 不用怎么提示农场主们就会告诉你，“该死的养狗人”是他们生活的灾星。

sentences.en: I am a scourge, I was the lamb, and the lion flock.
sentences.cn: 我不是任人鞭打的羔羊, 我是猛狮, 不与羊群为伍.

sentences.en: I tell you there is another sort of scourge in the air.
sentences.cn: 我告诉你们,还有另外一种灾祸就要临头了呢.

sentences.en: If you can rid our monastery of this scourge, that would be a great happiness for us!
sentences.cn: 你若能为我僧院除了这条祸根, 正是三生有幸了!

sentences.en: In Mr. Dimmesdale's secret closet, under lock and key, there was a bloody scourge.
sentences.cn: 在丁梅斯代尔先生深锁的密室中, 有一条血淋淋的刑鞭.

sentences.en: Nine mocking years with the golden calf and three long years of the scourge!
sentences.cn: 笑傲九年的物质财富,然后是整整三年的灾难!

sentences.en: Smallpox was once the scourge of the world.
The cruel captain used a scourge on his disobedient sailor.
sentences.cn: 那残忍的船长鞭打不服从命令的水手.

sentences.en: The scourge of racial tyranny should never again be allowed to raise its ugly head.
sentences.cn: 永远不能让种族主义暴政的祸患重新抬头。

sentences.en: They were the scourge of God upon the aborigines of the continent.
sentences.cn: 他们是上帝降在美洲土著当中的灾难.

sentences.en: This scourge must be stopped, he thought to himself.
sentences.cn: 他自己认为这场灾难必须被阻止.

sentences.en: To scourge a man is to beat him with a whip.
sentences.cn: 鞭笞人就是用鞭子抽打他的人.

words.tran_cn: 鞭；灾祸；鞭子；苦难的根源

trans.tran_cn: 天灾，灾难，鞭子，苦难的根源
trans.tran_en: something that causes a lot of harm or suffering
to hit someone with a whip as punishment in the past

trans.tran_cn: 鞭打，重惩，重责，使痛苦，严惩
trans.tran_en: to hit someone with a whip as punishment in the past
